title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots reportedly interested in trading for Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before Tuesday's NFL deadline.
Dolphins demand at least a third-round pick for Phillips, with 49ers and Eagles also interested.
Phillips ranks 11th in pressures, tied for 13th in pass-rush win rate, and excels at stopping the run.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei scratched for third consecutive Bruins game against Hurricanes, as Boston wins consistently with current lineup.
Coach Marco Sturm encourages Lohrei to use roster exclusion as a learning opportunity to improve defensive skills.
Lohrei-McAvoy pairing outscored 10-7 in 120:21 minutes, while new McAvoy-Zadorov pairing allows only one goal in 55:56 minutes.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 3-4 record and Michael Penix as their starting quarterback.
Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and poses a dual-threat challenge to the Patriots.
The Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed per game, with A.J. Terrell leading a strong secondary.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez's plays helped the Dodgers win Game 6, 3-1, against the Blue Jays.
Betts hit a crucial two-run single in the third inning, breaking his World Series slump.
Hernandez made a pivotal defensive play in the ninth, throwing out a runner to end the game.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston's Halloween night showcased creative costumes, including a notable McDonald's inspired ensemble by a 4-year-old from Newton.
MBTA staff distributed candy on the T dressed as characters like a pirate, Wizard of Oz, and a 'T princess'.
Boston Children's Hospital hosted Celtics star Jayson Tatum, while Eastie highlighted community events and festive decorations.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 Powerball ticket bought in Marlborough, Massachusetts, remains unclaimed and expires on November 20.
The ticket was sold at New Capital Farms Convenience Store and features numbers 16-30-60-62-64 with Powerball 25.
If unclaimed, the prize will be redistributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns, per state lottery officials.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married on Halloween at Salem's Willows Park.
The couple visited Salem for a week, awaiting their marriage license before the Halloween ceremony.
Justice Penny Richards officiated the wedding, which was covered by Jay Willet of WBZ for broadcast.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points as the Boston Celtics secured a narrow 109-108 win over the Philadelphia 76ers.
Despite late-game struggles, the Celtics held off the 76ers' comeback to achieve a third straight victory.
Anfernee Simons recorded a team-high +23, highlighting his significant impact as the Celtics built their lead.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash for a Halloween costume depicting a bloodied Jacqueline Kennedy, calling it a 'statement'.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's costume, labeling it 'disgusting, desperate and dangerous', on social media.
Fox defended her costume choice, highlighting it as a symbol of Jackie Kennedy's resilience after JFK's assassination.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Michael Penix Jr. and Drake London will play against the Patriots after missing last week's game with injuries.
Penix and London were full participants in Atlanta's Friday practice, preparing for the Week 9 matchup.
The Falcons aim to break a two-game losing streak against the 6-2 Patriots, who are on a five-game win streak.
